More than 80% come from California & that is one of two dangers for the current drought that California & making it worse. Every single almond takes one gallon of water to grow. A snack bag of 25 almonds is the same as 25 gallons. There are about 2.5 billion pounds grown each year which is roughly
The second threat is from Nestle !!
The Center for Biological Diversity filed a notice of appeal as it continues a fight to stop the Swiss-based food and drink company from diverting tens of thousands of gallons of water each day from Strawberry Creek, 70 miles east of Los Angeles.Nestle uses a 4-mile pipeline at the creek for its bottling operations in Ontario, Calif. The environmental groups estimate that Nestle takes 36 million gallons of water from the creek each year.

I used to drive a truck with double trailers in the almond orchard, during the September harvest, in California.  Same as they show at the beginning of the video, in the processing plant.  24/7 operation, very dusty.  Almonds are also expensive because newly planted trees take seven years to grow before the first crop.  The most interesting part of the harvest is when they dislodge the nuts from the tree - a low tractor with two long arms grabs the trunk and shakes it violently, knocking the husks free.  Farmers tell the same joke - the "L" in almond is silent because they shook the "ell" out of them.
